p: Finally, in anise essential oil, the main phytochemical group was by far the aromatic fraction (99.57 ± 0.05%), with four compounds identified, in which the leading component was trans-anethole (99.46 ± 0.05%). The rest contained within this fraction did not reach percentages higher than 0.1%: methyl chavicol (0.04%), p-anis aldehyde (0.04%), and cis-anethole (0.03%). Only two more compounds, the sesquiterpene hydrocarbons, α- cis-bergamotene and α- trans-bergamotene, were identified in P. anisum essential oil.
